claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A flowchart showing selection of a study cohort (age ≥18 years, N=18,467), exclusion criteria, resulting in an analyzable cohort (N=14,590) divided into controls (N=12,837) and influenza cases (N=1,803), then further categorized by vaccination status: RIV4, SD-IIV4, and unvaccinated. The figure only presents the study population selection and distribution of vaccine groups; it does not mention mutations during production or effectiveness implications and therefore does not support the claim.
